docs.snippet: Retired players and their beneficiaries can now vote on the deal, which includes a promise from the N.F.L. to pay an unlimited amount of awards to players with certain neurological conditions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Retired players and their beneficiaries can now vote on the deal, which includes a promise from the N.F.L. to pay an unlimited amount of awards to players with certain neurological conditions.
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody approves preliminary settlement between NFL and lawyers for over 4,500 retired players who sued league for concealing risks of concussions; had rejected earlier $765 million deal over concerns that money would not cover 65-year life of settlement; new agreement, to be voted on by 20,000 retired players, removes cap on damages but allows NFL to contest unlimited number of requests for awards.

headline.main: Altered N.F.L. Settlement Wins Judge’s Approval
headline.print_headline: Altered N.F.L. Settlement Wins Judge’s Approval

docs.snippet: The taunting of Juan Camilo Zúñiga points to racial tension in a country where writers and scholars long argued that prejudice and discrimination had been avoided....
docs.lead_paragraph: The taunting of Juan Camilo Zúñiga points to racial tension in a country where writers and scholars long argued that prejudice and discrimination had been avoided.
docs.abstract: Racism expressed by many Brazilians toward Colombian player Juan Camilo Zuniga after World Cup game against Brazil points to racial tension that exists in the country; Zuniga had kneed Brazil's top player Neymar in the back, which resulted in a broken vertebra.

headline.main: Neymar’s Injury Sidelines Effort to End World Cup Racism
headline.print_headline: Injury Sidelines Effort to End World Cup Racism

byline.contributor: Paula Ramon contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil.

docs.snippet: FIFA’s disciplinary committee rejected a request by Brazil’s soccer federation to punish the Colombian player whose tackle knocked Brazil’s top player, Neymar, out of the World Cup....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA’s disciplinary committee rejected a request by Brazil’s soccer federation to punish the Colombian player whose tackle knocked Brazil’s top player, Neymar, out of the World Cup.
docs.abstract: FIFA's disciplinary committee rejects request by Brazil's soccer federation to punish Juan Camilo Zuniga, Colombian player whose tackle of Brazilian star Neymar knocked him out of World Cup.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: FIFA Won’t Act on Neymar Hit Due to Referee’s Ruling

docs.snippet: The N.C.A.A. recommended that football teams hold no more than two contact practices a week during the season....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. recommended that football teams hold no more than two contact practices a week during the season.
docs.abstract: NCAA recommends that college football teams hold no more than two contact practices a week during the season, in guidelines that emerged from 2014 safety and concussion conference.
